techniques.title: Active Recall
techniques.description: Test yourself frequently instead of just re-reading notes
tips: Practice problems without looking at solutions

techniques.title: Spaced Repetition
techniques.description: Review material at increasing intervals to strengthen memory
tips: Focus on difficult concepts more often

techniques.title: Chunking
techniques.description: Break large amounts of information into smaller, manageable pieces

techniques.title: Dual Coding
techniques.description: Combine visual and verbal information to enhance memory
tips: Use both words and pictures in notes

techniques.title: Concrete Examples
techniques.description: Use specific, real-world examples to understand abstract concepts

techniques.title: Feynman Technique
techniques.description: Explain complex concepts in simple terms to identify knowledge gaps

techniques.title: Elaborative Interrogation
techniques.description: Ask yourself 'why' and 'how' questions about the material

techniques.title: Self-Explanation
techniques.description: Explain the reasoning behind each step while learning

techniques.title: Mind Mapping
techniques.description: Create visual representations of information to see connections
tips: Start with main topic in center

techniques.title: Cornell Note-Taking
techniques.description: Divide notes into sections for better organization and review

techniques.title: SQ3R Method
techniques.description: Survey, Question, Read, Recite, Review for effective reading

techniques.title: Concept Mapping
techniques.description: Show relationships between different concepts visually
tips: Use different shapes for different types

techniques.title: Retrieval Practice
techniques.description: Practice recalling information from memory without looking
tips: Close your book and write what you remember

techniques.title: Distributed Practice
techniques.description: Spread learning sessions over time rather than cramming

techniques.title: Generation Effect
techniques.description: Create your own examples and questions instead of just reading

techniques.title: Interleaving
techniques.description: Mix different types of problems or subjects in study sessions
tips: Don't study one topic for too long

techniques.title: Planning & Goal Setting
techniques.description: Set specific learning goals and create study plans
tips: Break large goals into smaller ones

techniques.title: Reflection & Review
techniques.description: Regularly reflect on what you've learned and how you learned it

techniques.title: Self-Monitoring
techniques.description: Track your understanding and adjust study strategies accordingly
tips: Rate your confidence after each topic

techniques.title: Collaborative Learning
techniques.description: Work together with others to solve problems and discuss concepts

techniques.title: Peer Teaching
techniques.description: Teach concepts to classmates or study partners
